fields.value: Studying Immigrant Policy One Law at a Time

dsDescriptionValue.value: These data include law-level information for 2,703 legislative actions by the 50 American states from 2005-2016. There are also aggregated composite measures that pool across years to make a single cross-section, that create a panel structure, and that pool across years to make scores by policy area.

files.description: This R script estimates models that have to recall the original micro-level law data to make new aggregation decisions. This script thereby shows users how an alternate aggregation can be performed on the fly in a new analysis.
files.label: alternateAnalysis.R

dataFile.description: This R script estimates models that have to recall the original micro-level law data to make new aggregation decisions. This script thereby shows users how an alternate aggregation can be performed on the fly in a new analysis.

files.description: This file is only necessary if the user wants component data that eventually went into the cleaned data. This ZIP file contains all of the component data read by dataClean.R. This includes immLawsMaster12.csv (a messy version of the micro-level law data), stateImmig0511.dta (replication data from Monogan 2013 that includes some cross-sectional predictors), fb.csv (cross-sectional data on change in foreign born population), ccesIdeolPanel.csv (aggregated CCES ideology data by state and year), pcRealGSP.csv (per capita GSP by state and year in 2009 dollars), and partyControl.dta (information on when a state has unified party government by state and year).
files.label: componentData.zip

dataFile.description: This file is only necessary if the user wants component data that eventually went into the cleaned data. This ZIP file contains all of the component data read by dataClean.R. This includes immLawsMaster12.csv (a messy version of the micro-level law data), stateImmig0511.dta (replication data from Monogan 2013 that includes some cross-sectional predictors), fb.csv (cross-sectional data on change in foreign born population), ccesIdeolPanel.csv (aggregated CCES ideology data by state and year), pcRealGSP.csv (per capita GSP by state and year in 2009 dollars), and partyControl.dta (information on when a state has unified party government by state and year).

files.description: Replication data from Creek & Yoder's (2012) analysis of states' adoption of 287(g) agreements.
files.label: creekYoder2.xlsx

dataFile.description: Replication data from Creek & Yoder's (2012) analysis of states' adoption of 287(g) agreements.

files.description: R code to replicate Creek & Yoder's (2012) model of 287(g) agreements and then use their data in a model of immigration law enforcement policies from 2005-2016.
files.label: creekYoderUpdate.R

dataFile.description: R code to replicate Creek & Yoder's (2012) model of 287(g) agreements and then use their data in a model of immigration law enforcement policies from 2005-2016.

files.description: This R script estimates all of the primary models reported in the main text and produces the figures and maps reported there. This file needs four data sets to run: immLawsMasterClean.csv, stateAggregate.csv, policyArea.csv, and panelImmig.csv.
files.label: dataAnalysis.R

dataFile.description: This R script estimates all of the primary models reported in the main text and produces the figures and maps reported there. This file needs four data sets to run: immLawsMasterClean.csv, stateAggregate.csv, policyArea.csv, and panelImmig.csv.

files.description: This R script reads all of the files stored in componentData.zip, so those files need to be in the working directory to use this program. The program cleans and combines these data sources, aggregates data as appropriate, and produces output files ready for analysis. Anyone wishing to replicate the models can skip this file. It is useful for those wishing to retrace the data management steps or borrow syntax in other data cleaning settings.
files.label: dataClean.R

dataFile.description: This R script reads all of the files stored in componentData.zip, so those files need to be in the working directory to use this program. The program cleans and combines these data sources, aggregates data as appropriate, and produces output files ready for analysis. Anyone wishing to replicate the models can skip this file. It is useful for those wishing to retrace the data management steps or borrow syntax in other data cleaning settings.

files.description: This file contains micro-level data about 2,597 legislative actions from 2005-2015. Omnibus laws are split into multiple components, with indices using decimals to uniquely identify rows. Five coders' scores are presented for two variables as well as the compilation across scores. The law's topic, bill number, state, year, and summarization are also included. Readers are encouraged to use this micro-level data if they need to compile information that has not been previously aggregated.
files.label: immLawsMasterClean.tab

dataFile.description: This file contains micro-level data about 2,597 legislative actions from 2005-2015. Omnibus laws are split into multiple components, with indices using decimals to uniquely identify rows. Five coders' scores are presented for two variables as well as the compilation across scores. The law's topic, bill number, state, year, and summarization are also included. Readers are encouraged to use this micro-level data if they need to compile information that has not been previously aggregated.

files.description: Data that aggregate laws by state and year. Predictors that are measured temporally are in time-variant form, whereas cross sectional predictors (such as change in foreign born population and legislative professionalism) are repeated annually.
files.label: panelImmig.tab

dataFile.description: Data that aggregate laws by state and year. Predictors that are measured temporally are in time-variant form, whereas cross sectional predictors (such as change in foreign born population and legislative professionalism) are repeated annually.

files.description: Data that aggregate laws by state and policy area. Within a policy area, laws are pooled across all years from 2005-2015. All predictors are included in cross-sectional form.
files.label: policyArea.tab

dataFile.description: Data that aggregate laws by state and policy area. Within a policy area, laws are pooled across all years from 2005-2015. All predictors are included in cross-sectional form.

files.description: Documentation file to start with. An overview of the contents of all of the data and code files.
files.label: readme.rtf

dataFile.description: Documentation file to start with. An overview of the contents of all of the data and code files.

files.description: Data that aggregate laws by state, pooling across all years from 2005-2015. All predictors are included in cross-sectional form.
files.label: stateAggregate.tab

dataFile.description: Data that aggregate laws by state, pooling across all years from 2005-2015. All predictors are included in cross-sectional form.
